Remove `debug-bidi-mapper` flag from ChromeDriver

Introduced in https://crrev.com/c/6433672, the experimental CLI argument `--debug-bidi-mapper` flag was meant to provide a fallback in case of some regression happened during transition from visible BiDi-CDP Mapper tab to a hidden target. Now this flag can be removed, as no regression was reported.

mac: Record linker output SDK as macOS 26.0, without changing the SDK

This convinces macOS 26 (and its betas) to enable new features gated on
the macOS 26 SDK being used at build time, before actually migrating to
that SDK (which is currently in beta, and which we wouldn’t normally use
until released). On macOS < 26, this white lie is a no-op, as older
versions won’t change behaviors if this field is set to anything newer
than they’re aware of. On macOS 26, this enables Liquid Glass, and
disables the undesirable SystemVersionCompat OS version reporting, where
macOS 26 calls itself macOS 16.

[ios] Add unit tests for TipsNotificationCriteria

This change introduces a comprehensive suite of unit tests for the
`TipsNotificationCriteria` class. This class is responsible for
determining whether a given tips notification should be scheduled.

Similar tests are removed from the TipsNotificationClient unit
tests since coverage is now provided by the new tests.

[omnibox][toolbelt] Init ctxl search provider if toolbelt is enabled

Currently, `ContextualSearchProvider` only created if lens entry match
is enabled 'OmniboxContextualSearchOnFocusSuggestions'.

This CL creates the provider if either that or the 'OmniboxToolbelt'
feature are enabled.

There's still some lens stuff that won't work as intended if we only
enable toolbelt feature without the contextual feature. But at least the
rest of the toolbelt will work.

[NTPFooter] Fix Crash When Incognito Error Page is Shown

This CL fixes the crash detailed in crbug.com/425975689.

Checking for the error page fixes the footer showing (with the wrong
content) on the incognito error page.

Checking for the WebUIController fixes the issue of a null controller
when a new tab is opened with throttle which had previously caused a
crash.

Corner-shape: fix edge cases for corner alignment

Use the actual insets for the thickness instead of inferring them from
the corner,as the corners themselves are adjusted in some occasions.

Also, use the full code path for hyperellipses rather than the no-border
code path.

This makes the thickness code a bit more straightforard and fixes a few
edge cases where the border width is bigger than the radius.

[omnibox][toolbelt] Hide location bar RHS page action

There are 4+ lens features that need to work nicely together:
1) Toolbelt has a 'ask about this page' lens action
2) Omnibox has a 'ask about this page' lens entry match
3) Omnibox has contextual zero suggestions
4) Location bar has RHS lens page actions

This CL hides (4) when (1) or (2) are enabled. Only hides the generic
lens page action; doesn't hide the homework-lens variant as we want to
nudge the user in that case to help discovery.

Original behavior, (1) toolbelt lens enabled yet (4) RHS lens still
displayed: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8xKF2Eehsb4ybhq

[InputVizard] Setup WidgetInputHandlerHost connection on
VizCompositorThread.

This change fixes broken interactions on sites like Google Maps when
InputOnViz is enabled. The issue occurred because the
VizCompositorThread did not receive necessary touch action updates from
the renderer's main thread, which caused gesture handling to fail.

This CL allows Viz-initiated WidgetInputHandler connections to provide
their own WidgetInputHandlerHost. The WidgetInputHandlerManager in the
renderer now sends updates to both the browser and Viz hosts, ensuring
the Viz thread has the correct state for input handling. These updates
are limited to the `SetTouchActionFromMain` and
`DidStartScrollingViewport` methods, as they are the ones required
within the current scope of InputVizard. The browser's
WidgetInputHandlerHost remains solely responsible for other methods,
such as those related to IME or mouse input handling.

An investigation into other WidgetInputHandlerHost methods can be found
at:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nF-fHl2te_Lw5IubLPVlEeNal3BSVLqgANmFi7akZb4/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-09ySaghg9j1_lAAzcWpr6Q

Add browser test for restrictOwnAudio, and switches for autosharing
screen with audio.

Add browser tests for restrictOwnAudio that checks if the correct
audio deviceId is created with the possible values for
restrictOwnAudio and suppressLocalAudioPlayback.

This test needs a screen to be auto picked. A new chrome switch
(kAutoSelectScreenCaptureSource) is added to accomplish that. There
is and old kAutoSelectDesktopCaptureSource that can autoselect
screens based on name. But the screens have different names on
different platforms, and can be different on the same platform if
you have one or several screens. So the old switch is hard to use.
This new kAutoSelectScreenCaptureSource autoselects any screen, so
you loose control, but you don't need to know the name of the
screen.

The test also need that system audio is shared. So a
kSystemAudioCaptureDefaultChecked is added to change so system 
audio is shared by default when sharing a screen or window.

The kScreenCaptureAudioDefaultUnchecked is renamed to
kTabCaptureAudioDefaultUnchecked). From the ScreenCapture prefix it
was hard to understand it only effected the share audio toggle on
the share tab selection, so it is renamed to have a TabCapture
prefix.

Download location dialog: Distinguish user-confirmed result from default

The DownloadLocationDialog may sometimes not be shown, such as in
situations where there is only one option for download location. This
CL makes the dialog properly communicate when this happens, rather than
behaving as if the dialog were shown and confirmed by the user.
The user did not actually see and confirm a dialog. It is
important to draw this distinction, because other dialogs in the
DownloadTargetDeterminer flow behave differently depending on whether
the user has seen and confirmed any previous dialog.

[ios] Avoid creating expensive object for unrealized WebStates

The AutofillTabHelper and PasswordTabHelper used to create complex
objects when they were constructed even for unrealized WebStates.
This caused unnecessary work during startup and shutdown, leading
to hangs for users with large number of tabs.

Change them so that they only create the objects when the tab is
realized (taking care of the case where they are created for a tab
that is already realized).

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1478523}

[ios] resolve warnings/errors by Swift 6

This CL fixes warnings/errors generated by Swift 6. Swift 6 provides
the safer ways to handle multi-threading. The new warnings/errors
introduced by Swift 6 are mostly around actors and `Task`s:

- Actor isolated call:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/actor-isolated-call/
- Sendable closure captures:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/sendable-closure-captures/
- Mutable global variable:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/mutable-global-variable/
- Conformance isolation:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/conformance-isolation/
- Sending risks data race:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/sending-risks-data-race/

[iOS][26] Safely converts item hash to Int

Converting `NSUInteger` item hashes to Swift `Int` can cause crashes due
to large hash values exceeding `Int`'s capacity. This change uses
`Int(truncatingIfNeeded:)` to safely convert these hashes, truncating
values if they're too large, thus preventing crashes.

Fixed: 427411410
Change-Id: I3027683384a3d470f35dc2ae83a1bc94eefefc0f
Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6668135
Auto-Submit: Alex Ilin <alexilin@chromium.org>
Reviewed-by: Ryan Sultanem <rsult@google.com>
Commit-Queue: Alex Ilin <alexilin@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1478505}

Defer reload in CookieControls bubble to fix race condition.

PROBLEM
A crash would occur when the user triggered the reloading UI, which
starts a spinner animation and immediately begins a page reload.

CAUSE
The spinner (Throbber) uses a timer with callbacks bound to a WeakPtr.
If Reload is triggered immediately after the user presses the button,
the associated widget/view may be destroyed before the timer stops. This
leads to a use-after-free when the Throbber tries to schedule paint
callbacks on a now-invalidated widget.

FIX
This change serializes these operations, and the `Reload()` call is now
deferred. The delayed task callback first stops the spinner animation
and begins closing the bubble. Only after the UI is safely being torn
down is the page reload initiated. A 200ms delay is used to ensure the
spinner is visible before the reload begins.

Note -- this change ends up making the reloading timeout for the TP UI
bubble obsolete (since we close the bubble after a fixed amount of
time). Once I've verified this fix in canary I'll send a followup to
clean up the timeout metrics.

These flags are initially set to enabled, since the Search in CCT feature will be launched as an experiment to allow embedding apps to choose to use this behaviour. The intention is that the embedder will be able to trigger the Search in CCT feature behaviour depending on its needs.

[Autofill] Remove ShouldAllowCreditCardFallbacks()

For the unowned form, non-iOS does not call FormData::set_action() and
iOS calls FormData::set_action(GURL("")). In either case,
GURL::is_valid() is false.

Therefore, `client.IsContextSecure()` is equivalent to
`!IsFormOrClientNonSecure(client, form)` if `form` is unowned.

Auto-Submit: Ameur Hosni <ameurhosni@google.com>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1478477}

[ios] resolve warnings/errors by Swift 6

This CL fixes warnings/errors generated by Swift 6. Swift 6 provides
the safer ways to handle multi-threading. The new warnings/errors
introduced by Swift 6 are mostly around actors and `Task`s:

- Actor isolated call:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/actor-isolated-call/
- Sendable closure captures:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/sendable-closure-captures/
- Mutable global variable:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/mutable-global-variable/
- Conformance isolation:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/conformance-isolation/
- Sending risks data race:
https://docs.swift.org/compiler/documentation/diagnostics/sending-risks-data-race/

This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

Stop searching for ancestors when it is hopeless.

When we have a selector like .a > .b ~ .c, and find .b
but the parent isn't .a (the child combinator fails),
we'd go back and continue searching for more siblings
matching .b. This is not useful; we can just stop immediately,
as all siblings will have the same parent.

We already did the right thing for descendant combinators.

IDB: Implement lock partitioning for the SQLite backing store

The logic for building PartitionedLockRequests for all types of
transactions is now encapsulated in indexed_db::Database rather than
being spread across Transaction and ConnectionRequest. The specific
relationships that need to be maintained between the lock partitions are
now clearly visible in one place.

Slightly modernize CountryNamesForLocale

No functionality change, but some modernizations/optimizations:
- Return a reference instead of a copy in GetCountryCode.
- Make non-optimal out-parameter a mutable reference.
- Avoid copies in GetLocalizedNames.
- Avoid a copy in CountryNamesForLocale constructor.
- Default the move constructor.
- Accept a string_view as GetCountryCode locale parameter.

[anchor] Always initialize style in OOFCandidateStyleIterator.

Re-initializing via Reset() would fail with null style_ if we had
exhausted all fallbacks, if the last fallback was non-existent.

Add a correctness test, that would also crash without this fix.

work for the permission element.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6551238. That
CL was reverted as it was causing issues with Zoom and Meet who were
using display: flex and display: block (not deliberately, but
inherited). This CL does also allow flex and block as values so it
should be safe to re-add.

Don't read/write kSyncedDefaultSearchProviderGUID pref

As the first step in cleaning up the
switches::kSearchEngineChoiceTrigger flag, remove code that
conditionally reads/writes the deprecated syncable pref instead of the
new local pref.

This change should be a no-op in terms of visible behavior, though it
does stop writing the syncable pref (which was done even in the feature
enabled path).

Subsequent CLs will complete the pref migration, and remove other usages
of the feature flag.

bindings/heap: Move GC prologue callbacks to ThreadState

ThreadState is already the home for anything garbage collection
related in Blink. It combines the various GC related calls and ways to
attach GC to an Isolate for custom logic around some weakness
clearing.

The CL moves the prologue and epilogue callbacks to ThreadState as
well to unify the place where GC behavior is customized. This makes it
easier to find and explain where GC is configured in Blink.

Auto-Submit: Takuto Ikuta <tikuta@chromium.org>
Commit-Queue: Sylvain Defresne <sdefresne@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1478399}

skcms HDR v2: Add support for new HLG and PQ representations

The new HLG and PQ representations explicitly specify the HDR reference
white luminance (aka SDR white level), and (for HLG) the peak luminance
and system gamma as parameters in the skcms_TransferFunctions. They also
include the HLG OOTF in the color space transform.

Leave both implementations present and functional, because HLGish and
PQish spaces are still being created via SkColorSpace::MakeCICP (for
now, it will be removed).

Store these parameters in the gfx::ColorSpace::transfer_params_ member.
Of note is that, with this change, transfer_params_ aligns with
skcms_TransferFunction (so this could allow replacing transfer_params_
with an skcms_TransferFunction in a future change).

Make the gfx::ColorSpace constructor that takes an SkColorSpace populate
the new transfer_params_ values.

Make gfx::ColorSpace::ToSkColorSpace use the new representation by
default.

Remove unused parameter from cc::PaintImage::GetContentColorUsage.

Inline gfx::HDRMetadata::GetReferenceWhiteLuminance into its only
caller, cc::ToneMapUtil::AddGlobalToneMapFilterToPaint, since it needs
to take into account the source color space now.

Be robust to receiving the HLG and PQ (as compared to HLGish and PQish)
skcms_TransferFunctions. This means, in places where we check
skcms_TransferFunction_isHLGish (the old version), also check
skcms_TransferFunction_isHLG (the new version).

[Blink] Move ImageBitmap resource provider from CRCHost to context

The only subtle part is ensuring that the resource provider continues to
be reset at every relevant place where
OffscreenCanvas::DiscardResources() is called (note:
ImageBitmapRenderingContextBase sets a resource provider *only* for
offscreen canvas).

They are:

* Dispose() [1]
* from within ImageBitmap context itself in Reset()

The other calls are all for other context types and/or
HTMLCanvasElement.

[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/offscreencanvas/offscreen_canvas.cc;l=123?q=offscreen_canvas.cc&ss=chromium

Migrate `WebSchedulerTrackedFeature` to mojom enum

This will provide type-safety when passed across process boundaries.

This CL migrates the enum from C++ definition to a mojo enum and uses it
in the .mojom file where we previously used a uint32.

This use `using` in web_scheduler_tracked_feature.h to avoid needing to
update all sites where this enum is used.

NO_IFTTT=IFTTT is beig introduced in this CL.

Preloading: Separate out `eager` and `immediate` eagerness levels

Previously, they are collapsed into `immediate` at the Blink level.
This CL separate them out while keeping observable behaviors of Chrome,
that is, we introduce a new enum item `kEager` for `eager` but treat
it as "immediate" eagerness. This CL is a preliminary change to make
room for future improvements on the `eager` eagerness.
See the design doc for details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YPbtUPfZIDElzBZNx8IQMzRFvy8oauLG_i1XIr6jgTs

NO_IFTTT=No behavioral changes are made in this CL.

Migrate proxy_browsertest.cc off of SpawnedTestServer.

In particular, ProxyBrowserTest.BasicAuthWSConnect uses it both for a
proxy and to handle WebSockets. This is also the only test using the
ProxyBrowserTest test fixture (which is in its own header file). This
CL moves the text fixture into the proxy_browsertest.cc file, and
switches the one test using it to using EmbeddedTestServer for both
the proxy and for the destination server..

It also does some additional cleanups:

* It removes a filter that blocks results for Gaia URLs (likely needed
  because the SpawnedTestServer falls over when dealing with multiple
  connections at once)
* It deletes the Python handler for "proxied-request-check" websocket
  requests, since this was the only test using it.
* It moves "proxied_request_check.html" from net to chrome, since it's
  only used by this test. It was in its old location because it needed
  to be co-located with the aforementioned Python handler.

__Http- cookie prefix

This CL implements the __Http- [1] cookie
prefixes. They enable site operators to know that a certain cookie was
issued with the HttpOnly attribute, and was not set by a malicious
script on the client side.


[1] https://github.com/httpwg/http-extensions/pull/3110

net/disk_cache: Implement SQL backend entry management

This CL introduces the initial implementation of an SQL-based backend
for the disk cache, including the core logic for managing cache entries.

Key changes include:
- Addition of `SqlBackendImpl` and `SqlEntryImpl` to handle cache
  operations and entry management using an SQLite database.
- Implementation of core entry management methods like
  `OpenOrCreateEntry`, `OpenEntry`, `CreateEntry`, and `DoomEntry`.
- Integration of the SQL backend into existing disk cache tests, with
  some tests skipped via `SKIP_IF_SQL_BACKEND_NOT_IMPLEMENTED` due to
  pending feature implementations.
- Basic unit tests for `SqlBackendImpl`, specifically for `MaxFileSize`.

Further work will involve implementing the remaining methods in
`SqlBackendImpl` and `SqlEntryImpl`, and adding more comprehensive

Report all process termination from RenderProcessHost::Cleanup() as normal

When subframe in a page is intentionally removed and the renderer
process for the subframe is killed,
Stability.Android.ProcessedCrashCounts UMA metrics wrongly counts it as
oom.

The normal termination entrypoints of RenderProcessHost on Android are
Cleanup() and FastShutdownIfPossible(). On process failure or oom,
RenderProcessHost::OnChannelError() or
RenderProcessHost::OnProcessLaunchFailed() is executed.

On FastShutdown(), OnChannelError(), OnProcessLaunchFailed() cases,
RenderProcessHost::ProcessDied() triggers RenderProcessExited() observer
callback.

On Cleanup(), it calls FastShutdown() if applicable, otherwise it calls
RenderProcessExited() observer callback directly.

normal_termination on
ChildExitObserver::ProcessRenderProcessHostLifetimeEndEvent() have
missed the Cleanup() without FastShutdown() case and wrongly counted the
termination as not normal one.

I tested locally this change by removing a subframe (counted as "kill")
and killing a renderer process for a subframe (counted as "oom") and
check Stability.Android.ProcessedCrashCounts in chrome://histograms.

media: Move NoSupportedEncryptionScheme calculation to reduce codec loop

When we detect that there is no intersection between all encryption
schemes and the supported encryption schemes of a specific codec, we
can return early that there are no supported encryption schemes, instead
of looping through the other codecs and calling IsTypeSupportedEx for
each one of them.

This is because of the following ex:

HEVC -> reports supported for CENC, CBCS, so intersection stay same.
VP9 -> reports unsupported for CENC, CBCS, so intersection goes to {}
H264 -> reports supported for CENC, CBCS, intersection still stays at {}
AV1 -> reports supported for CENC, CBCS, intersection still stays at {}

So instead, when the intersection is empty, we should return early to
avoid the extra calls to the IsTypeSupportedEx API.

Verified on my Windows Desktop:

With this change, and without this change, the same capabilities are
reported.

Avoid exiting the child process when ipc is reset for android.

The termination flow of renderer processes from RenderProcessHostImpl
is:

1. GetChildTerminationInfo() which unbinds all service binding to the
renderer process. AMS (ActivityManagerService) sends SIGKILL to the
process when there is no service binding to the process.

2. ResetIPC() which causes TerminateSelfOnDisconnect() in the renderer
process due to a disconnection. The renderer process exit(2).

These terminations are executed asynchronously.

If the renderer process exits by TerminateSelfOnDisconnect() before AMS
kills the process, AMS tries to restart the process and to kill the
restarted process again when unbinding request arrives because child
processes are implemented as a Service in Android.

To avoid the useless restart, child processes should be alive until AMS
explicitly kills the process.

With the KeepChildProcessAfterIPCReset feature enabled, child processes
on Android do not exit on mojo channel disconnection. If the process is
terminated by RenderProcessHostImpl, AMS will kill the process soon.
Even if the channel is disconnected for other reasons,
RenderProcessHostImpl always unbinds service bindings to the process and
AMS kills the process.

The child process may leak if mojo has a bug and mojo does not notify
RenderProcessHostImpl of the channel disconnection. A task which crashes
the child process is scheduled 1 minutes after to detect the unexpected
mojo bug and the leaked process.

in destroyed state.

media: Optimize encryption scheme query in MediaFoundation

If we already query the video codecs for cenc-clearlead, we should
avoid calling IsTypeSupportedEx again per codec for checking the cenc
encryption scheme to save time.

Testing:

Key System: com.microsoft.playready.recommendation
Robustness: Hardware Secure
Name: PlayReady Content Decryption Module
Version: 10.0.22621.5124
Path: N/A
Status: Enabled
Capabilities: {"Audio Codecs":["aac"],"Encryption Schemes":["CENC"],"Session Types":["temporary"],"Video Codecs":{"h264":[],"hevc":[]}}

Histogram: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.PlayReady.HardwareSecure.GetCdmCapability recorded 1 samples, mean = 1814.0 (flags = 0x41) [#]
0     ...
1782  -O                                                                        (1 = 100.0%) {0.0%}
2117  ...

With my change:

Key System: com.microsoft.playready.recommendation
Robustness: Hardware Secure
Name: PlayReady Content Decryption Module
Version: 10.0.22621.5124
Path: N/A
Status: Enabled
Capabilities: {"Audio Codecs":["aac"],"Encryption Schemes":["CENC"],"Session Types":["temporary"],"Video Codecs":{"h264":[],"hevc":[]}}

Histogram: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.PlayReady.HardwareSecure.GetCdmCapability recorded 1 samples, mean = 1489.0 (flags = 0x41) [#]
0     ...
1262  -O                                                                        (1 = 100.0%) {0.0%}
1500  ...

We verify that the same capability is reported on my Windows desktop,
and that the GetCdmCapability time improves from 1782 to 1262 ms.

Store ImageReader related state in its own class

This CL moves ImageReader related state into its own class,
ImageHandler. This simplifies some logic relating to having to ignore
updates to mAcquiredImageCount if the ImageReader has been recreated.
Also, in a follow up CL, we will need to store multiple ImageReaders
to support resizing. This is because we need to hold on to old
ImageReaders until all of their Images are finished being used by the
native side.

[Reading mode] Refactor toast styles to ensure horizontal centering and responsiveness

Moved toast styling from app.css into language_toast.ts to ensure
styles are correctly applied. The previous styles were being
overridden due to language_toast being imported later, making the
app.css rules ineffective.

The new styles explicitly center the toast horizontally using
left: 50% and transform: translateX(-50%). The width is set using
clamp(245px, 80%, 100vw - 48px) to prevent the toast from overflowing
on small screens. The 48px accounts for the 24px left/right margins
applied by the toast component, ensuring consistent visual alignment.

Here it is a couple of images of how it looks after the change:
    - A bit large: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/CA4KdsALNMC4NPV.png
    - Medium: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/ivqyYBMXiqAK8nr.png
    - Small: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8yASMWG6H6DThPJ.png

[PixAL] Check eligibility before showing prompt

Currently, the server eligibility is not checked before showing the
account linking prompt.

The server call to get eligibility is made as a non-blocking call.
Check if the user is eligible before showing the prompt.

If the server call has not returned by the time the client is ready to
show the prompt, it is not shown. The server call is made when the user
is paying on their bank app, so there is sufficient time for the server
call to complete. This case is generally not expected.

[PixAL] Show prompt after the user has returned to Chrome

Currently, the account linking prompt is shown as soon as a user without
linked Pix account copies a Pix payment code. But we don't want to add
friction to their checkout flow, so the prompt should be shown after
payment.

This change introduces the logic to wait for the user to exit Chrome
(for payment) and then return before showing the prompt. Specifically,
Chrome waits to be moved to the background and return to the foreground,
and only then shows the account linking prompt.

Note:
1. Chrome does not actually check if the user opened their bank app or
if they completed payment. During the checkout flow, leaving and
returning to Chrome is a strong signal of payment.
2. If the tab from which the Pix code is copied is closed or if the
Chrome app itself is closed, the prompt will not be shown.

Screen recordings->
1. Prompt shown after returning to Chrome (WAI): https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTQ1OTMzODg0Mjg2NTY2NHxmYTE4NDE4ZC04NA
2. Prompt shown only once after returning to Chrome (WAI): https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTQ1MjgzNDEwMjMxMjk2MHxkMmEwOTgxNy1hNQ
3. Prompt not shown if Chrome is closed (WAI): https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTMzMDYzMTIyMjM2MjExMnw2M2Y4Nzk3ZC0yYg
4. Prompt is shown even if there is a page navigation (Issue): https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjQ3NDA3MzcyMTc5ODY1NnwxMjA2MmY3NC04YQ
(While this is useful for same origin navigations, the prompt shouldn't
be shown for different origins)
5. Prompt is shown when the user has switched tabs (Issue): https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjU3OTcwODUwOTU1MjY0MHw4NjA0NzM4MS0wMQ
6. Prompt not shown if the tab is closed (WAI): https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjU5MTk1MjcyMzExNjAzMnxjM2EzOTNiMi1lZA

Ash: Adapt SearchResultsTest for tablet mode

This CL adapts AppListViewTest.SearchResultsTest to correctly test app
list behavior in tablet mode.

In tablet mode, the app list is always fullscreen. The test is updated
to verify the state transitions between kFullscreenAllApps and
kFullscreenSearch when the user types in the search box.

To exit the search results page, the test now calls view_->Back(), which
more accurately simulates user actions like pressing the Escape key.
This fixes an issue where simply clearing the search box text did not
trigger the correct state transition back to kFullscreenAllApps.

The test logic has also been simplified for clarity and an obsolete TODO
was removed.

Test: ash_unittests --gtest_filter=AppListViewTest.SearchResultsTest

[pip] Ensure pip windows stay tucked when resized for child dialogs

We tuck picture-in-picture windows to the side of the screen while file
dialogs are open. We also resize document picture-in-picture windows
when they have a large child dialog to ensure the child dialog is not
clipped. If the child dialog resizing happens after the window is
tucked for a separate file dialog, then the window ends up on the
screen. To avoid this problem, this CL ensures that a document
picture-in-picture window is re-tucked if necessary when it resizes for
a child dialog.

[views-ax] Only expose virtual children or views children in automation

The automation API currently exposes both the views' children and the
virtual children. This, however, is not how Views and the virtual
children system should work. Instead, if there are virtual children,
they should override the "real" views children completly. The "real"
children should only be exposed when there are no virtual children.

See this comment in ViewAccessibility:
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/views/accessibility/view_accessibility.h;l=774?q=view_accessibility.

And look for references to the virtual_children member in
ViewAXPlatformNodeDelegate for additional examples of how it should
work.

disk_cache: Introduce DeleteLiveEntriesBetween() in SqlPersistentStore

This CL introduces a new method DeleteLiveEntriesBetween to
SqlPersistentStore.

This method allows for the deletion of cache entries that were last used
within a specified time range. It also provides an option to exclude a
set of CacheEntryKeys from deletion.

The CL includes:
- The new interface method in SqlPersistentStore.
- The implementation in SqlPersistentStoreImpl and Backend.
- Unit tests in SqlPersistentStoreTest.
- A new histogram variant DeleteLiveEntriesBetween for tracking the
  performance and error results of this operation.

[Extensions WebIDL] Support required callbacks using extended attributes

This CL changes the WebIDL processor to mark returns_async fields as
optional by default and allows them to be marked as required through the
use of a new extended attribute 'requiredCallback'. Also adjusts
existing tests to account for this and adds a new test for the new
extended attribute.

Also adds a TODO to clean some of this up in the future once we remove
the context restrictions on promise based API calls.

Background context:
Generally callbacks are inheriently optional when calling an extension
API function, as not including the callback will cause the function to
instead return a promise for any asynchronous response. However we still
carry the 'optionality' of the callback (returns_async) through the
bindings for either 1) callers from contexts which do not support
promise based calls (non-MV3/WebUI contexts) or 2) specific API
functions which still do not support promise based calls (multi-
parameter callbacks, etc.).

EditAddressProfileDialogControllerImplTest into InProcessBrowserTest

Use of BrowserWithTestWindowTest is being deprecated and existing tests
requiring a Browser environment are being migrated to being browser
tests.

This CL updates the EditAddressProfileDialogControllerImplTest fixture
to an InProcessBrowserTest and removes the BrowserWithTestWindowTest
dependency.

The CL also fixes a crash on startup by delaying the creation of the
test `AutofillProfile` until `SetUpOnMainThread`, ensuring its
dependencies are initialized. Additionally, it fixes an issue in the
`WindowTitleOverride_TitleUpdatedWhenParamIsPresent` test where a
`base::MockOnceCallback` was being reused after it had been consumed.

tree source. It provides a constant time access to any serialized

scale factor. There are many ways to fix this, but I followed the fix
for a similar issue from

Move Mojo Union::NewT helpers into .cc file

In C++23, std::unique_ptr<T> requires a complete definition of T in
order to destroy T. Simply reordering the declarations here is
insufficient, as structs can embed unions, and unions can embed structs.
Rather than trying to do something fancy like a topological sort of
dependencies, just move the definition into the .cc file.

[omnibox][toolbelt] Fix AI and lens actions DSE & locale restrictions

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6QTaVGWdZHWxXCq

With this CL,
- lens is restricted to google DSE but not to locale en
- AI mode is restricted to google DSE and locale en

Before, lens action was guarded to google DSE and 'en' locale.

Google DSE guard was unnecessary because the core lens feature is
already restricted to google DSE and the toolbelt lens action is
restricted to when the core lens feature is enabled.

'en' locale guard is no longer desired; we decided to show lens action
to all locales.

In contrast, AI mode action still requires these 2 restrictions but
wasn't guarded before.

So this CL moves the DSE and locale guards from the lens action to the
AI mode action.

Commit-Queue: George Dregalo (xWF) <dregalo@google.com>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1478199}

[crd webauthn] Health-checks IPC with timeout

Once the WebAuthn remote is bound, we rely on the fact that the
disconnect handler will be called whenever the IPC disconnects or the
remote session ends to tell if the remote is actually valid. However,
crbug.com/425759818 shows that this is not necessarily reliable. Even
though the issue has been mitigated, reliability can still be improved.

getRemoteState sort of does an explicit IPC "health check" by calling
QueryVersion on the remote, but it isn't applied to all other requests
and it doesn't have a timeout logic. This CL improves this by moving the
QueryVersion to EnsureIpcConnection (and renaming it) and adding a
timeout logic that treats the remote as disconnected if no response is
received in 5 seconds.

With this change, the NMH will consider the IPC connection to be
disconnected if the host hasn't bound the pending receiver to a
`WebAuthnProxy` receiver within 5 seconds.

Only synchronize layers that have rounded corners

We allowed LayerTreeSynchronizer to synchronize square layers in
crrev.com/c/6471644. However, this caused a performance regression in
overview. Synchronizing purely based on intersection with reference
bounds resulted in many layers with rounded corners. Applying rounded
corners to these extra layers has a non-trivial performance impact on
low-end devices.

Add new .cr-scrollable-top-shadow class to show shadows for scroll

This CL extends the .cr-scrollable-* classes to include a separate class
for showing a shadow when the scrollable container is scrollable in the
top direction. This is in preparation for removal of
CrContainerShadowMixin and other JS implementations of watching for
scroll to show the shadow.

Also adds an additional class .force-on to always show the scrollable
indicators and updates gallery demo.

Add UiEventDispatcher skeleton, and wire to ExecutionEngine

ToolRequests will be passed into this new object pre- and post-
invocation of ToolController. This object will be responsible for
finding the correct per-profile ActorStateUiManager and passing to it a
list of events that may update UI state.

This object will be responsible for translating ToolRequests to a
sequence of events. It will also be responsible for providing status
back to ExecutionEngine.

ExecutionEngine now maintains a basic state machine of its callback
sequence, used only for logging and DCHECKs.

Remove dependency of flat_tree on span

This implies that plain arrays cannot longer be passed directly into
a flat_tree. But, if necessary, users can use a span or an initializer
list.

The goal of this CL is to reduce the compile size contribution of
flat_tree.h. Span accounted for almost 90% of it.

The compile-size bot reports an improvement of 36MiB.

[menu] Activation behavior for open/close menu on arrow navigation

This patch updates the HTMLMenuItemElement::DefaultEventHandler method
to handle invoking menulist on arrow key navigations. We follow the
suggestions as outlined by APG for menubar [1].

- If element is a menuitem in a menulist,
  - If arrow RIGHT,
    - If menuitem invokes a sub-menulist,
      - If sub-menulist is closed, show the sub-menulist.
      - Focus on its first child.
    - Else, close all popovers. If it has an ancestor menubar and its
      ancestor invoker has a next menuitem, focus on that next menuitem.
  - Else if arrow LEFT,
    - Close the menulist that this menuitem is a child of.
    - If its invoker is in a menulist, focus on this invoker.
    - If its invoker is in a menubar, focus on the previous menuitem.
- Else if element is a menuitem in a menubar,
  - If element invokes a menulist,
    - If arrow UP, focus the last menuitem in the menulist.
    - Else if arrow DOWN, focus the first menuitem in the menulist.

Note these changes are for arrow navigation starting from a menuitem. A
follow-up patch for menulist invoked from button might be necessary.

[1] https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/menubar/

requiring a Browser environment are being migrated to being browser
tests.

InProcessBrowserTest and removes the ChromeColorsService dependency.

This CL migrates the ChromeColorsService unit test from using the
deprecated `BrowserWithTestWindowTest` to `InProcessBrowserTest`.

The main changes involve:
- Updating the test fixture to inherit from `InProcessBrowserTest`.
- Changing `SetUp()` to `SetUpOnMainThread()`.
- Replacing `AddTab()` with modern `ui_test_utils` navigation methods.
- Renaming the test class to `ChromeColorsServiceBrowserTest`.
- Using `browser()->profile()` instead of the `profile()` helper.

The original unit test file is removed and replaced with the new browser
test.

IDB: handle double deletion in SQLite store.

calling deleteDatabase() on a non-existent database normally doesn't
even create a Database object, but if it does exist and
deleteDatabase is called on it twice, the first call will delete the
DatabaseConnection and the second call (enqueued behind the first)
needs to be able to handle this state.

Bug: 40253999
Change-Id: I64279e940e79af5435447cda7cf9304d5f61a288
Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6658503
Reviewed-by: Abhishek Shanthkumar <abhishek.shanthkumar@microsoft.com>
Commit-Queue: Evan Stade <evanstade@microsoft.com>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1478097}

SQL: revise guidance around triggers and add ability to enable them

Previous guidance and code banned the use of SQLite triggers without
exception. The reasoning is the (unsubstantiated) claim that triggers
"increase the difficulty of reviewing and maintaining" SQL usage.

The guidance is updated to add nuance: misuse of triggers is bad, but
there are also appropriate ways to use triggers. If code/queries get a
lot simpler (to review, maintain, update, etc) with the use of triggers,
then they should be applied. Otherwise, steer clear.

A new DatabaseOptions field is introduced to allow enabling triggers.
We could just enable triggers by default, but making this a non-
default configuration aligns with the guidance to avoid triggers most
of the time, and increases the likelihood that the guidance will be
discovered and read.

IndexedDB's SQLite implementation is updated to enable triggers. IDB is
easily the most sophisticated client of //sql in Chromium (after WebSQL
has been disabled) by number of and complexity of queries. As a case
study of code that is better served by the use of triggers, IDB has
several paths for deleting a record (i.e. row in the records table),
which then has a cascading effect on some other SQLite tables:

1. records can be deleted explicitly, given a certain key range
2. records can be deleted by deleting or clearing the object store
   that they're in.
3. a record can be *updated* via Put(), which is equivalent to
   deleting the old row and inserting a new one (via Put())

In all cases, the table that tracks blob references must be updated, and
the table that holds blobs may also need to be updated depending on the
remaining references. This means that *multiple* additional queries
would need to be written for *each* of the above record deletion
pathways, as well as any future record deletion pathways that are added.
A pair of triggers greatly simplifies this process. (Note this is just
one example of the application of triggers in IDB code; there are more.)

Fix C++23 compile error in base::DictValue

In C++23, T must be complete definition when destroying a
std::unique_ptr<T> using the default deleter. This particular instance
is a bit tricky: base::DictValue needs to be defined before base::Value,
since base::Value has a std::variant field that holds, among other
things, a base::DictValue. Instead, just move the definition of the
problematic templated constructor below the complete definition of
base::Value.

objects of another ViewAccessibility. Because AXVirtualView children

tree. Exposing children through a unified interface makes it cleaner
and easier to understand.

Remove MultiBufferNeverDefer v2 implementation in prep for v3

No amount of post-connection closing is fully sufficient to mitigate
the network deadlock which can occur when too many video tags are
spun up. We instead need to use per-origin connection limits and a
notification system for waking up waiting writers.

This CL preps the way for that by removing the v2 implementation.

Unify code paths in UpdateLastImage()

We intend to use RasterScopedAccess in UpdateLastImage(). In order to
make it simpler to reason about the code logic, we will perform the
following refactoring sequence:

1. Extract ReplaceAcceleratedSkImage() out of an else-branch.

2. then move ReplaceAcceleratedSkImage() further out of the outer
if-else block, so that this function always gets executed when the
VideoFrame has SharedImage.

3. now that ReplaceAcceleratedSkImage() is guaranteed to run for the
SharedImage codepath, we can confidently start the scoped access in
ReplaceAcceleratedSkImage().

This CL represents step 1 above and step 2 and 3 will be performed
in follow-up CLs.

[TopControls] Add a custom view for toolbar hairlines

This CL continues the work of adding a TopControlsStacker for all the
top control views. This CL creates a custom ToolbarHairlineView that
can be included by other views to replace the current approach, which
is each view including an ImageView with the same drawable. We use this
approach so that we can make the hairline view itself a TopControlLayer,
which is not feasible if the hairline is included directly by each
view, which themselves may need to be top controls. We also update all
places currently using a hairline to use this new view.

Bug: 400486355
Original change's description:
> [tvOS] Make iOS test runner infrastructure support tvOS
>
> This makes it possible to call e.g. <out-dir>/bin/run_base_unittests
> and other run.py wrappers on tvOS builds.
>
> tl;dr: Using run_*tests on both tvOS and iOS should Just Work without
> any user-visible changes.
>
> Running tests on an actual device is still not supported, so the device
> test runners still all hardcode iOS as the only supported platform.
>
> The actual required changes are quite simple:
> - iossim_util needs to accept tvOS runtimes when parsing `simctl
>   list`'s  output.
> - We need to pass different paths to DYLD_{LIBRARY,FRAMEWORK}_PATH
>   depending on whether this is a tvOS or an iOS build.
>
> The latter is achieved by deriving the intended target platform from the
> value passed to --platform since the platform name will have a fixed
> device type identifier we can use.
>
> Other relevant changes:
> - wpr_runner_test.py and xcodebuild_runner_test.py: Make some test
>   classes derive from test_runner_test.SimulatorTestRunnerTest so that
>   they can call setUp() there, which adds the appropriate iossim_util
>   mock for the new call in SimulatorTestRunner's constructor. This also
>   allows us to remove some duplicated mock calls that are all
>   centralized in the parent class's setUp() implementation.
>
> Note that this CL does not change xcode_util, which remains unable to
> download tvOS SDKs and images. This must be done separately as part of
> bug 400486355.
>
> With help from Abhijeet Kandalkar <abhijeet@igalia.com>
>

[InputVizard] Add crash keys for long compositor frame sink destruction

This patch introduces instrumentation to record crash keys when the
destruction of a root `CompositorFrameSink` takes an unusually long time
(exceeding `kAnrThreshold`). This will help to diagnose potential ANRs
we are seeing in field.

Specifically, it:
- Modifies `FrameSinkManager::DestroyCompositorFrameSink` to accept an
  optional `request_time` parameter. If provided and the `FrameSinkId`
  is a root sink, it calculates the duration of the destruction.
- If the destruction duration exceeds `kAnrThreshold` (100ms), it
  posts a task to `DumpCrashKeys`.
- `InputManager` is updated to record the start time and duration of
  various operations (`SetupRenderInputRouter`,
  `OnCreateCompositorFrameSink`, etc.) using a new `ScopedOperation`
  helper class.

[iOS] Create Feature Engagement features for Lens & Customization badges

This change introduces two new Feature Engagement features (and a new
group) for displaying "new" badges on the homepage. One badge is for the
Lens entry point, and the other is for the home customization menu.

The group ensures that only one of these badges is shown per session and
that neither badge appears immediately after the user's first run.

This CL defines the core Feature Engagement constants, metrics, and
configurations for these features. It also includes unit tests to verify
their behavior.

Note: The code required to trigger these IPH features (e.g., querying
the tracker, firing ShouldTriggerHelpUI(), notifying events) will be
implemented in a follow-up CL.

Implement "directionality of an attribute" and use it for title.

This implements the HTML spec's concept of "directionality of an
attribute" (which can differ from the element's direction for certain
attributes when the element has dir=auto), and uses that concept for the
directionality of the title attribute (which is the only place blink was
using the element directionality with the value of an attribute).

Migrate DevtoolsInterceptionWithAuthProxyTest to EmbeddedTestServer.

It was using a SpawnedTestServer acting as an auth proxy.
SpawnedTestServer is deprecated for a variety of reasons, so this CL
makes it use EmbeddedTestServer configured to give proxy auth challenges
instead. The EmbeddedTestServer doesn't actually proxy requests,
instead handling them directly, but there's no need to it to really
proxy anything for this test.

Conveniently, this also lets us enable the test on Fuchsia. It was
disabled there because SpawnedTestServer::TYPE_BASIC_AUTH_PROXY does
not work on Fuchsia.

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477995}

Promisify scroll: element.idl changes behind a flag.

While the IDL change here cannot be gated directly by the RTE flag
`ProgrammaticScrollPromise` due to Blink IDL limitations, the return
values exposed to JS remains `undefined` through the use of
`EmptyPromise`.

We know about one exposed regression here which seems too contrived to
cause any compat concerns: a malformed `element.scroll*()` call no
longer throws synchronously; instead it now returns a Promise
synchronously which throws asynchronously.

Reviewed-by: Vladimir Levin <vmpstr@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477994}

waffle: Remove missing keywords DB country leniency

Including the country in the DB metadata has been implemented for 10+
milestones already. Allowing clients to have this country unset is
not necessary anymore, there is 0 chance that a client without a
country set would also not have its data re-merged for some other
reason, as the keywords data version has also been bumped a few times
since then.

So this code that was supporting the initial choice screens rollout can
now be removed.

Rename interesttarget attribute and friends

**** GARDENERS: Please note! ****
  Please do me a huge favor and don't revert this CL if there are a
  few test flakes after landing it. Instead, please just mark those
  tests as flaky/fail and assign me a bug and I'll get it cleaned up.
  Thanks in advance!
*********************************

There have been a few standards conversations about naming:
- https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9236#issuecomment-2940736593
- https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/11312

Per those conversations, this CL renames the following:
 - the `interesttarget` attribute becomes the `interestfor` attribute
 - `interestTargetElement` -> `interestForElement`
 - CSS `interest-target-*-delay` -> `interest-*-delay`

I also renamed the feature flags and associated code, so that the new
names are code-searchable. I did not rename the IDS string var names,
so that we don't waste time on re-translating them.

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477964}

[Blink] Extensions can bypass renderer-side forbidden header checks.

Specifically allow scripts that have origin access to the fetch() target
to bypass forbidden headers on fetch.

Before this change nothing was allowed to set forbidden headers in fetch
requests. This is intentional and part of the web spec.

However, there is now an allowance for Chromium to allow extension
(scripts) with origin access to the URL (e.g. host_permissions in
extensions parlance) to set these forbidden headers.
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R3ndiV4iMu2QaqbbkFbP9GO27oKi8gXmmfrSU4HUMj0/edit?usp=sharing

Extensions are already allowed to bypass CORS rules for fetch() targets
with their host_permissions by calling
WebSecurityPolicy::AddOriginAccessAllowListEntry().

After this change these allowlist entries are reused renderer-side to
allow scripts to set forbidden headers. Because extensions are the only
users of AddOriginAccessAllowListEntry(), this practically means that
only extensions with host_permissions can set forbidden headers in the
renderer.

This is only half the work because the browser validates these headers
after they are sent from the renderer. However, that will be a more
complicated adjustment so it is reserved for a future CL.

Migrate LoginProxyBrowserTest off of SpawnedTestServer.

Make LoginProxyBrowserTest use the EmbeddedTestServer's partial proxy
support instead of a SpawnedTestServer proxy, as part of an effort to
delete SpawnedTestServer.

Previously, LoginProxyBrowserTest inherited from ProxyBrowserTest in
order to use its logic to set up a proxy. EmbeddedTestServer supports
less general pseudo-proxying (CONNECT directect to one destination
only, non-CONNECTs handled directly), so this CL adds the necessary
code to set up and configure the proxy to LoginProxyBrowserTest
directly, which is a bit unfortunate.

[iOS]Manage Accounts Coordinator’s stop close the view

The `stop` method should usually close its own view controllers.

Before this CL, the view was dismissed either:
* in `closeSettings`, which was called when this view is opened in the settings,
* when the parent view is dismissed by its own parent view, in the case of the account-menu,

This second case is not the way coordinators are suppsoed to works,
and also stops working with the fix in crrev.com/c/6662560.

After this CL, we guarantee that the view controller is always
dismissed exactly once. Either by `closeSettings` if in the settings,
or by `stop` otherwise.

Reviewed-by: Charles Hager <clhager@google.com>
Reviewed-by: Lijin Shen <lazzzis@google.com>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477949}

Sync pointer on pressdown in Windows

Windows requires the pointer to be within the bounds of the program for
it to start a drag and drop, otherwise the ::DoDragDrop call to the OS
will not work properly. With mouse drag and drops this is never an
issue, but when engaging with a touch device, this scenario is possible.

To address this, currently, whenever a drag and drop operation is
started and the pointer is detected to be outside of the browser's
window, instead of initiating a DnD we sync the pointer to the location
of the touch, and expect the user to attempt a second time to initiate a
drag. This CL changes this mechanism to sync the pointer when a
pressdown is first detected, instead of waiting for the long press. With
this change, by the time a long press is detected and a drag start is
attempted, the pointer will already be where it is supposed to be and a
drag can seamlessly start.

A deleted comment mentions some concern about aggressively moving the
user's pointer, but moving the cursor does not move the mouse. After a
touch, the pointer is synced, and if the mouse is moved afterwards it
will remain where it was.

Fix logic for pending animations waiting on a start time.

A previous change introduced a regression, by erroneously assuming
that an animation that was scheduled to start in an earlier frame
would be already on the "waiting for start time" list. A composited
animation could be modified in such a way that it picks up a new
compositor group, and thus it will no longer match when the group
gets its start notification. A composited animation that is not
synchronized to align its start time with new animations, must
be re-added to the wait list if its compositor group changed.

Reparameterize the setup for "wavy" decorations

Add a WaveDefinition struct that contains the low-level parameters for
a "wave". This is basically reusing the concepts that was previously
defined via functions - WavyStep() and WavyControlPointDistance() - as
well as the phase of the wave. Change the "step" parameter to be
"wavelength" instead (double the step).

For the spelling/grammar decorations, we can now let
TextDecorationInfo::SetLineData() define an override "wave" by
constructing an appropriate WaveDefinition, while the "default" wave is
defined from the decoration thickness.

The helpers are updated to take a WaveDefinition as a parameter, and the
construction of the base "wave" path is split out into a function of its
own (WavyPath).

This should allow to make DecorationGeometry struct simpler in a future
CL by storing the parameter struct rather than artefacts generated from
it.

Actor: delay after type tool before page stability

Drop downs often wait until a user finishes typing to fetch and display
a list of available options. This can be done via, e.g. setTimeout
that's reset on every keystroke. This means that after type tool injects
a key event sequence, the effects of that may not be fully processed
until after such a timeout.

This CL changes the minimum delay time into an observation delay - that
is, a delay before the page stability monitor starts to watch the page.
Like the minimum delay, this ensures that page stability waits at least
as long as this delay. Unlike the minimum delay, if network requests are
still pending at the end of this delay - or the main thread is busy, the
page stability monitor will delay until those settle. i.e. This delay
expands the amount of time the monitor is waiting for the tool to
execute.

Additionally add some more detailed logging to the monitor to help
diagnose issues in the future.

[DBSC] Split cookie rotation result histogram by a trigger

This CL adds an extra suffix to split
"Signin.BoundSessionCredentials.CookieRotationResult" and
"Signin.BoundSessionCredentials.CookieRotationTotalDuration" histograms.
The new suffixes capture a reason that triggered a cookie rotation
request.

The new histograms are recorded by BoundSessionRefreshCookieFetcherImpl
that receives an immutable trigger enum value via constructor. The
trigger value is computed by the BoundSessionCookieControllerImpl that
initiates the fetch.

Also, a little bit of extra plumbing is added to
BoundSessionCookieRefreshServiceImpl to pass an information about
whether a session is initialized from a disk data on startup or a brand
new session is just being registered.

[iOS] Fix keyboard overlap calculation in Drive File Picker

The keyboard frame notification provides frames in screen coordinates.
This change converts the keyboard frame to the window's coordinate
space before calculating the safe area insets.

This ensures the view is correctly adjusted only for the portion of the
keyboard that actually overlaps with the application's window. It also
handles cases where the keyboard frame is outside the window bounds by
resetting the insets.

[Android] Fix SegFault in generation controller

If a focus change happens, the password generation controller resets the
generation_element_data_ and the active_frame_driver_. But it doesn't
remove the entry point to generation which means ShowBottomSheet may be
triggered on the reset objects. This seems to work mostly because the
reset objects are copied before use (which is probably unintentional).

These copies operate on undefined default values and thus cause the
segfault.

This CL checks whether the objects are reset and returns nullptr and
false as appropriate which prevents the segfault.

The case reproduced on a SDK 34 emulator on the IMDB registration page.

browser_tests, and switch to taking a list of ports. Instead of always

Untangle FreeType and HarfBuzz build

Before switching to Fontations, HarfBuzz and FreeType needed to be built
together so that FreeType can identify certain glyphs as belonging to
autohinting categories and applying autohinting correctly to them. In
Skia, when switching to the Fontations backend, this dependency is no
longer needed. When Fontations performs autohinting it has own logic to
identify the glyph category.

Separate the builds of HarfBuzz and FreeType, and pass WITHOUT_HARFBUZZ
define to FreeType.

Required preparation for removing FreeType from the Blink/Chromium
build.

Rename freetype_harfbuzz target to harfbuzz and update targets that
require it.

Changes to build/ are needed to remove the indirection: We change from
from build/ -> third_party:freetype_harfbuzz ->
third_party:freetype_sources to build/ -> third_party:freetype.

[menu]: Fix toggle-menu command with light dismiss

`NearestTargetPopoverForInvoker()` finds the nearest target popover for
a given popover invoker that is a form control or button element.
Before this CL, this algorithm didn't consider HTMLMenuItemElements as
possible popover invokers, meaning it never returned relevant opened
HTMLMenuListElement popovers.

This CL updates this algorithm to consider HTMLMenuItemElement as a
popover invoker, and return its associated target menulist as a
popover. This corrects `FindTopmostRelatedPopover()`, which makes light
dismiss for clicks aimed at <menuitem>s work the same as <button>s.

Concretely, this ensures we do not double-activate a menuitem when we
click it and its popover is open. This fixes the behavior of the
`toggle-menu` command, ensuring it works the same as `toggle-popover`
on buttons/traditional popovers.

R=masonf

[tvOS] Make iOS test runner infrastructure support tvOS

This makes it possible to call e.g. <out-dir>/bin/run_base_unittests
and other run.py wrappers on tvOS builds.

tl;dr: Using run_*tests on both tvOS and iOS should Just Work without
any user-visible changes.

Running tests on an actual device is still not supported, so the device
test runners still all hardcode iOS as the only supported platform.

The actual required changes are quite simple:
- iossim_util needs to accept tvOS runtimes when parsing `simctl
  list`'s  output.
- We need to pass different paths to DYLD_{LIBRARY,FRAMEWORK}_PATH
  depending on whether this is a tvOS or an iOS build.

The latter is achieved by deriving the intended target platform from the
value passed to --platform since the platform name will have a fixed
device type identifier we can use.

Other relevant changes:
- wpr_runner_test.py and xcodebuild_runner_test.py: Make some test
  classes derive from test_runner_test.SimulatorTestRunnerTest so that
  they can call setUp() there, which adds the appropriate iossim_util
  mock for the new call in SimulatorTestRunner's constructor. This also
  allows us to remove some duplicated mock calls that are all
  centralized in the parent class's setUp() implementation.

Note that this CL does not change xcode_util, which remains unable to
download tvOS SDKs and images. This must be done separately as part of
bug 400486355.

With help from Abhijeet Kandalkar <abhijeet@igalia.com>

Rename/extend ElementAccessibilityIssue in devtools protocol for <summary>.

This change renames SelectElementAccessibilityIssue to
ElementAccessibilityIssue in the devtools protocol, and makes
corresponding changes to other types and fields, so that it makes sense
to use for elements other than the <select> element, in particular, for
the <summary> element.  This also adds a new
InteractiveContentSummaryDescendant reason for use with <summary>.

[Tab Model] Rework TabModelImpl#moveTab

Move tab was highly confusing. It was implemented in such a way that
moving a tab to a higher index required adding a +1 offset to account
for the fact the rest of the list would shift. This is not how list
reorder operations typically work and as a result lots of hacks to
workaround the issue existed in code. Just do what is more intuitive
instead and move the tab directly to the index.

New logic:

Tab Index < Destination Index - all the tabs before or at the
destination index will shuffle one index down to make room.

Tab Index > Destination Index - all tabs at or after the destination
index will shuffle one index up to make room.

[A11yPerformance] Use better containers for accessibility

This change contains many optimizations in one bang:

- Prefer Abseil flat associative containers over STL map/set. This not
  only switches from logarithmic to amortized constant time ops, but
  also reduces heap churn (each node in a map/set is a distinct
  allocation). This should also result in better memory patterns
  overall.
- Proactively reserve space in containers that are expected to hold a
  known number of items.
- OrderedSetContent is now a move-only type to avoid copies.
- Some map/set operations have been optimized (e.g., reduce the # of
  lookups).
- Use STL algorithms in some cases to walk containers.
- Replace uses of StringPrintf with base::StrCat -- it's phenomenally
  less expensive.
- Replace use of std::basic_string<>::operator+ with base::StrAppend.

A side effect of this change is that observers' methods that are
invoked repeatedly may now be invoked in a different
order. Previously, use of sorted containers meant that some methods
were invoked with ascending AXNodeIDs. This is no longer the case.

Pinpoint shows a reduction of ~25% in
BrowserAccessibilityManager::OnAccessibilityEvents for
very-many-nodes.html. The improvements are algorithmic, so pages with
more nodes will reap larger benefits.

disk_cache: Support large file on PrefetchData

This CL lets SimpleSynchronousEntry::PrefetchData accepts uint64_t size
file. The data read at once must be smaller, but the total file size
could exceed size_t limit.

It also updates the trailer size to uint32_t from int32_t. The default
value was -1 and now 0. This is used for the current conditioning which
is done as `size <= 0` manner so 0 and -1 will be handled in the same
way. This is tested in the existing tests.

This is a preparation for large file support.

This CL alone does not affect the behavior so far since the file size
and offset is already wrapped to int range incorrectly before coming
into PrefetchData.
It will be fixed in the following cls.

[iOS][safari-import] Safari import stage transitioning architecture

This CL implements different screens of the Safari import workflow, and
the coordinator to handle the transition.

Skeleton-coordinators are also created in this CL, one for each stage.
They do NOT yet show the desired view controller or run any import
logic. They are only created to demonstrate the transition workflow, but
UI and interaction handling will be implemented in later CLs.

Screen recording: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/WautVz6aw3jTyD5

Also manually tested with size-class updates (iPhone rotation and iPad
splitting screen during presentation) and fixed a couple of bugs in the
entry point view controller, which happens to have landed before this
one does.

[PasswordChange] Add successful toast confirmation timeout

The confirmation toast has a defined 8 seconds timeout in mocks.

The cancelled toast has one of 4 seconds specified currently, but I don't see a confirmation of that in mocks.

This CL aligns that logic and moves to one place in delegate's UpdateState(). If those two timeouts should be different, then the cancel timeout can be adjusted back later.

Stop silently allowing calls into Cronet's API from VersionSafeCallback

The fact that the code lives in VersionSafeCallback does not guarantee
that it is written in a ApiLevel-safe manner. To err on the safe side,
always require an opt-in for every new call into the API layer.

reporting and handling.

[line-clamp] Make text-wrap: balance work with the line-clamp ellipsis

(This CL is an alternative approach to the crrev.com/c/6543867,
crrev.com/c/6544146 and crrev.com/c/6543587 relation chain.)

With the `LineClampLineBreakingEllipsis` flag, which takes into
account the width of the line-clamp ellipsis during line breaking,
this width must be passed into the `LineBreaker` instance, since it
can't compute it based on the inline items.

This is handled when `LineBreaker` is used in `InlineLayoutAlgorithm`,
but it isn't when it is used in `ScoreLineBreaker` and
`ParagraphLineBreaker` to implement `text-wrap: {balance,pretty}`. To
make `text-wrap: balance` handle the ellipsis properly, we choose to
only implement this handling in `ParagraphLineBreaker`, so we disable
score line breaking when line clamping. In order to determine the
ellipsis width in `ParagraphLineBreaker`, we also add an
`InlineLayoutAlgorithm::ShapeLineClampEllipsis` static method.

Although this CL does not add any support for `line-clamp` together
with `text-wrap: pretty`, while working on this patch we noticed a
crash when those two features were used together. As a result, this
patch also adds a `text-wrap: pretty` crash test.

Reland "Handle owned frame buffers when zero-copy is enabled in MFVEA"

This reverts commit 3bf90b8efc46ab3b2377524e087b25d394ad63eb

Reason for revert: The unit test
RTCVideoEncoderEncodeTest.NoSoftwareFallbackOnMappableNativeInput
failed during the MemorySanitizer check due to improper lifetime
management of the VideoFrame object. This CL fixes the memory
access issue.

Original change's description:
> Revert "Handle owned frame buffers when zero-copy is enabled in MFVEA"
>
> This reverts commit 7301e6efe7a05aa2a25d24626d62d0a27a2f32af.
>
> Reason for revert:
> LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5839715321249792
>

Make AcceptCHFrameInterceptor handles added client hints

We aim to offload the AreCriticalCH handling from the browser
process's observer to the network layer if possible.
This CL implements the logic for checking that in
AcceptCHFrameInterceptor and is a part of series of CLs.

The feature works in the following way:
[1] Get client hints in the browser process on a request creation.
    https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6638933
[2] Plumb the client hints to the network layer.
[3] Verify the client hints on connection time.
(You can see the proof of concept in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6630130)

To minimize the change size per CL, the CL is written in
[1] -> [3] -> [2], and this is the [3] CL.
That is because the mojo change requires full picture of the
change, and I believe both sides should be ready before its change.

Use std::string_view in GetCanonicalLocale

The CL changes GetCanonicalLocale to accept a std::string_view to
enable modernizing the APIs in ui/base that use GetCanonicalLocale.
It is unfortunate that this requires a temporary copy to a
std::string_view, but the alternative (using a base::cstring_view)
would go viral and would require callers to also use cstring_view
in their parameters.

reason. This is triggered when a BFCached page receives a message from a

so that this change can focus solely on adding the new reason.

NavigationThrottleRunner2: Decouple request and runner

This patch decouples the NavigationThrottleRunner from the
NavigationRequest, and makes it owned by the NavigationThrottleRegistry.
The registry will manage the runner v1 and v2 flip, behind a flag.

In the v2 runner, it allows more than one deferring throttle, and
this new abstraction at the NavigationThrottleRegistryImpl defines
a modified API set to support the case. Currently, it just wraps the
v1 runner and calls the original API set to mimic the new API set.

The registry's callers should care for the multiple deferring throttles
after this change, though the actual underlying implementation may
support only one deferring throttle within the default config.

Add kBackForwardCachePostedMessage task type for Shared Worker BFCache

This CL introduces a new task type, `kBackForwardCachePostedMessage`, as
a preparatory step to allow SharedWorkers to be eligible for
Back-Forward Cache.

This is supported by a new QueueTraits flag, `can_run_in_bfcache`, which
marks tasks that must run even when a page is frozen inside the BFCache.
This allows messages from a SharedWorker to be delivered to a BFCached
client page to trigger an eviction. These tasks are still paused if the
page is frozen for other reasons.

For pages not in BFCache, the behavior of this task type is identical to
`kPostedMessage`.

For more details:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CI7iqg_NgK7NELOzK6jrF_Zk-FATilMwuO53M4ZApVg/edit?usp=sharing

[Blink] Move WebGPU resource provider from CRCHost to WebGPU context

The only subtle part is ensuring that the resource provider continues to
be reset at every relevant place where DiscardResources() is called.
They are:

* Dispose() [1][2]
* size change [3]
* from within WebGPU context itself on detecting a size mismatch [4]
  (note: potentially redundant with [3], but outside the scope of this
   CL)

The other calls are all for other context types.

[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/canvas/html_canvas_element.cc;l=456?q=html_canvas_element.cc&ss=chromium
[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/offscreencanvas/offscreen_canvas.cc;l=123?q=offscreen_canvas.cc&ss=chromium
[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/canvas/html_canvas_element.cc;l=1320?q=html_canvas_element.cc&ss=chromium
[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/webgpu/gpu_canvas_context.cc;l=205?q=gpu_canvas_context.cc&ss=chromium

Allow transparent look-ups in base::LRUCache

It is currently possible to construct a base::LRUCache with for which
the underlying container supports transparent comparison:
base::LRUCache<std::string, int> cache(10);

However, transparent look-ups do not work. The following does not
compile:
cache.Get(std::string_view("asd"));

This CL allows transparent Get and Peek in LRUCache.

Configure SequenceManager for Network Service at IO thread startup

This change refactors the Network Service Scheduler to use the thread's
existing `SequenceManager`, ensuring it is configured with the
appropriate priority settings during the IO thread's startup sequence
within the Network Service utility process.

Previously (https://crrev.com/c/6636537), the Network Service Scheduler
created its own `SequenceManager` on the current thread. While
functionally working, this approach, creating multiple SequenceManager
instances per thread, is not well-supported, breaks existing assumptions
(particularly in tests), and led to numerous test failures when the
feature was tentatively enabled [1].

Another attempt (https://crrev.com/c/6638798) tried to reconfigure the
existing `SequenceManager` on the current thread by dynamically updating
its priority settings. However, `SequenceManager` settings are typically
configured at construction and are not designed for dynamic
modification. Dynamically updating settings on the IO thread could cause
a race condition, as the main thread processing tasks might concurrently
read settings that are assumed to be immutable after construction.

To resolve these issues, this CL moves the responsibility of configuring
the SequenceManager with Network Service specific settings at IO thread
startup for the Network Service utility process.

The CL also decouples the scheduler's lifetime from the `NetworkService`
instance. It is now managed as a global variable
(`g_network_service_scheduler`), consistent with the pattern used by
other schedulers in Chromium. Previously, the scheduler's lifetime was
tied to the `NetworkService` instance. In tests where the
`NetworkService` is destroyed while a `RunLoop` is still active on the
same thread (e.g.,
`NetworkServiceTest.DestroyingServiceDestroysContext`), pending tasks
posted via the scheduler's default runner (such as `RunLoop`'s
`QuitClosure`) becomes invalid upon scheduler destruction. This prevents
`RunLoop`s from completing, resulting in timeouts.

With these changes, all tests pass even when the feature is tentatively
enabled [2].

As a minor change, the CL introduces a wrapper around
`SequenceManager::Settings` to avoid including the full
`sequence_manager.h` header from `base/threading/thread.h`. Including
`sequence_manager.h` directly from `thread.h` caused compile-size check
failures [3]:

> Compile size check failed! Delta (1120.25 MiB) exceeds threshold (300.00 MiB)

> Before: 383.78 GiB (412076643415)
> After: 384.87 GiB (413251311653)
> Delta: +1.09 GiB (+1174668238)
> Delta %: 0.29%

Finally, the CL adds a `network-service-scheduler` virtual test to
prevent regressions.

- [1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6636842?checksPatchset=5&tab=checks
- [2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6654497?checksPatchset=7&tab=checks
- [3] https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/compile-size/205599/overview

[e2e] Allow bottom chin to be visible by default on smaller tablets.

This feature will enable to run experiment with larger tablet where the bottom chin will be invisible by default to have a full e2e on large tablets.

* width < MinWidthThreshold: e2e disabled.
* MinWidthThreshold <= width < InvisibleBottomChinMinWidth: e2e enabled
  and the bottom chin is visible by default. Same as behavior on phone.
* InvisibleBottomChinMinWidth <= width: fully e2e and the bottom chin is
  invisible by default.

See https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6634791/comment/e738e5ac_54be6887/

Add SqlPersistentStore::OpenNextEntry for iterating cache entries

This change introduces a new method, `OpenNextEntry`, to the
`SqlPersistentStore` interface and its implementation. This method
allows consumers to iterate through all non-doomed cache entries,
ordered by `res_id` in descending order.

The method takes a `res_id` as a cursor, returning the entry with the
largest `res_id` less than the provided value. To fetch all entries,
the iteration can be started with `res_id` set to
`std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()`.

This CL also includes:
- Trace event population for the new method.
- Unit tests covering various scenarios, including empty cache,
  single/multiple entries, skipping doomed entries, and handling
  invalid data.

[soft navs] Create InteractionContentfulPaint performance entry.

Replaces the use of the existing LargestContentfulPaint performance
entry as a mechanism for emitting "soft LCP" paint timings. The exact
criteria, timing, and semantics are entirely unchanged in this patch,
just the name of the entry.

The single biggest side effect is that now observers of LCP performance
entries on the performance timeline will not get a single merged list of
paint timings, when observing buffered entries. Now, these two timings
are isolated and have their own unique buffers.

Future work will change this performance entry and some of its
semantics.

This patch also significantly refactors some of the older soft-nav WPT
tests as part of getting them to work with the new API.

[omnibox][toolbelt] AI mode starter pack

Adds starter pack. Will add toolbelt action in a follow up CL.

Icons:
- Location bar keyword view icon
  (`SelectedKeywordView::SetCustomImage()`)
- Popup match icon (`AutocompleteMatch::GetVectorIcon()`)

Strings:
- Location bar keyword view text
  (`SelectedKeywordView::GetKeywordLabelNames()`)
- Omnibox placeholder text
  (`AutocompleteMatch::GetKeywordPlaceholder()`)
- Null match text (`KeywordProvider::FillInUrlAndContents()`)
- starter pack match description
  (`featured_search_provider::StarterPackDescription()`)
- normal match description
  (`AutocompleteController::UpdateKeywordDescriptions()`)

A11y:
- `OmniboxEditModel::GetPopupAccessibilityLabelForCurrentSelection()`

This diverges from the similar @gemini starter pack. Instead it adheres
more closely to traditional site searches and other starter packs.
Specifically:
- @aimode has a placeholder, null match, verbatim match, historic
  matches
- All other site searches and starter packs likewise have all those
  listed above (except historic matches when not relevant; e.g. for
  @bookmarks)
- @gemini also has a placeholder, but does not have the others listed

We may migrate @gemini to behave like other keywords
(crbug.com/424918582); or we may modify @aimode to behave more like
@gemini; it's in discussion.

Ranked above @gemini starter pack.

Also renames `FillInURLAndContents()` -> `FillInUrlAndContents()` (lower
case URL) and `TemplateURL* element` -> `turl`.

Integrate FrameMetadataObserver with Paywall Signal

This CL moves the APC paywall signal check to use the new
FrameMetadataObserver push service. This new service will push the value
of the paywall signal once available without having to generate the
entire APC which is significantly faster. This new service is default on
behind a kill switch. Because of this kill switch, need to keep the old
paywall signal logic in case the push service gets turned off.

extensions: Add test for chrome.debugger.onEvent ordering

Add regression test to ensure chrome.debugger.onEvent maintains correct
ordering compared to normal CDP events. This prevents future breakage
of the event dispatch order that was fixed in http://crrev.com/c/6639022.

The test verifies that debugger events are dispatched in the same order
as they would be through normal Chrome DevTools Protocol, ensuring
consistency between the extension API and direct CDP usage.

[webgpu] Make canvas resources importable by WebGPU

Add SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_WEBGPU_READ to the CanvasResource shared image
(behind a flag) so that they can be imported into WebGPU without a copy.
Also, patch the WebGPU copyExternalImageToTexture implementation to
avoid an extra copy if the source image is already WebGPU compatible.

Enable the flag by default on Mac/iOS since we'll be using IOSurfaces
for the CanvasResource shared image anyway.

This is a reland of commit 1dab44202b599841c704583a0a5e8b3b50c591c7
which was reverted due to D3D12 debug layer crashes in WebGPU-WebGPU
canvas copy CTS tests on Windows Nvidia now marked as flaky in Dawn.

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477619}

Reduce XR shutdown flakiness

It appears as though there can be some race conditions during an XR
shutdown initiated outside of the device process. Essentially, during a
requested shutdown flow, the device process will explicitly disconnect
some of it's mojo pipes. This sends a disconnect message to the browser
process that is also processed as the end of a shutdown, and can lead
to racy behavior when the eventual callback to indicate the end of the
requested shutdown is actually processed. This addresses the issue by
removing the disconnect handler when we know a disconnect is likely to
be coming as a result of our explicit request and we expect to be
notified separately of that request finishing.

webcrypto: drop support for generating too-long RSA keys

Currently, chromium's webcrypto implementation supports generating RSA
keys with a modulus length of up to 16,384 bits. This value was
originally chosen because it was the largest supported modulus size in
NSS; the relevant WebCrypto spec[1] doesn't impose any limits on what
modulus sizes should be supported by implementations.

The BoringSSL team would like to reduce BoringSSL's maximum modulus size
to 8192, for reasons outlined here: https://crbug.com/402677800. Since
8192 is already an incredibly large modulus size for RSA, limiting the
size to this value seems entirely reasonable. A modulus of 16384 bits
would take *extremely* long to generate - probably several minutes or
more on a fast device - and doesn't provide any practical gain in
security over an 8192-bit modulus.

[1]: https://w3c.github.io/webcrypto/#ref-for-dfn-RsaKeyGenParams-modulusLength-1

inverted a null check. A browser test has also been added to guard
against future regressions.

Treat custom protocol schemes in the omnibox as URL on ChromeOS

This change makes the autocomplete classifier treat custom protocol
schemes like web+something:// as URL if this protocol can be handled by
an installed web app.
